Publication Title: Nucleoporin downregulation modulates progenitor differentiation independent of nuclear pore numbers
Publication Authors: Amy E Neely, Yang Zhang, Laura A Blumensaadt, Hongjing Mao, Benjamin Brenner, Cheng Sun, Hao F Zhang, Xiaomin Bao
Publication Abstract: Nucleoporins (NUPs) comprise nuclear pore complexes, gateways for nucleocytoplasmic transport. As primary human keratinocytes switch from the progenitor state towards differentiation, most NUPs are strongly downregulated, with NUP93 being the most downregulated NUP in this process.
